text: hey team, I have 2 text columns in HubDB. col-1 and col-2. I'd like to pull in col-2's contents, unless it is empty in the DB, as which point I want it to instead pull in col-1's contents. Any idea on how I can query the table contents first, before pushing an if statement?
could you just put both in variables and then test if the first one is set, if not, put the second one in?
you could also set a dict and then append to that dict with each value and test that way if you're inside of a loop.
Just `{{ row.col_2 or row.col_1 }}`  should do what you're looking for.
